H0.text: The Big Bang Theory is an event or principle that cannot have its validity directly tested by laboratory experiment.

H1.text: The Conservation of Energy cannot have its validity directly tested by laboratory experiment.

H2.text: The periodicity of element properties cannot have its validity directly tested by laboratory experiment.

H3.text: The Acceleration of Objects due to Gravity cannot have its validity directly tested by laboratory experiment.

A4.text: Precise modern models of the Big Bang appeal to various exotic physical phenomena that have not been observed in terrestrial laboratory experiments or incorporated into the Standard Model of particle physics.

A5.text: The key physical law behind these models, general relativity has passed stringent tests on the scale of the Solar System and binary stars.

A6.text: Milton A. Rothman wrote that the law of conservation of energy has been verified by nuclear physics experiments to an accuracy of one part in a thousand million million (10^15).

A7.text: In some speculative theories, corrections to quantum mechanics are too small to be detected at anywhere near the current TeV level accessible through particle accelerators.

A8.text: Moseley determined the value of the nuclear charge of each element from aluminium to gold and showed that Mendeleev's ordering actually places the elements in sequential order by nuclear charge.

A9.text: Moseley's research immediately resolved discrepancies between atomic weight and chemical properties; these were cases such as tellurium and iodine, where atomic number increases but atomic weight decreases.

A10.text: Standard gravity, or g, the standard value of gravitational acceleration at sea level on Earth

A11.text: Gravity of Earth, the acceleration caused by the combination of gravitational attraction and centrifugal force of the Earth
